actor_awards.notes: Power never received an Academy Award nomination, a fact often cited as a major oversight given his performances in films like 'Nightmare Alley' and 'Witness for the Prosecution'. He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame at 6747 Hollywood Blvd. He placed his hand and footprints in cement at Grauman's Chinese Theatre in 1937.

filmography.title: The Mark of Zorro
filmography.role_description: A Spanish aristocrat who adopts the foppish persona of a dandy by day to conceal his identity as the masked vigilante Zorro, defender of the poor.
filmography.plot: A young aristocrat in 19th-century California masquerades as an effete fop to deceive the corrupt alcalde while secretly fighting injustice as a masked swordsman.
filmography.awards: National Film Registry: Inducted (2009); Oscar: Nominated – Best Original Score; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Heroes & Villains (Nominated)

filmography.title: Nightmare Alley
filmography.role_description: A charismatic but amoral carnival barker who ruthlessly manipulates everyone around him to rise from a sideshow mentalist to a high-society spiritualist.
filmography.plot: An ambitious con man learns a mind-reading code from a carnival mentalist and uses it to fleece the wealthy, leading to his own tragic downfall.
filmography.awards: None (Now considered a Film Noir classic)

filmography.title: Witness for the Prosecution
filmography.role_description: A charming, seemingly naive inventor accused of murdering a wealthy widow, who relies on his barrister to save him from the gallows.
filmography.plot: A veteran British barrister defends a man accused of murder, but the trial takes a shocking turn when the accused's wife testifies for the prosecution.
filmography.awards: AFI: 10 Top 10 (#6 Courtroom Drama); Oscar: Nominated – Best Picture, Best Director, Best Actor (Charles Laughton), Best Supporting Actress (Elsa Lanchester)

filmography.title: The Razor's Edge
filmography.role_description: A traumatized WWI pilot who rejects his wealthy fiancée and privileged life to travel the world in search of spiritual enlightenment.
filmography.plot: An American pilot returns from World War I seeking the meaning of life, rejecting the materialist world of his socialite fiancée.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Anne Baxter); Nominated – Best Picture, Best Supporting Actor (Clifton Webb)

filmography.title: Blood and Sand
filmography.role_description: A poor illiterate boy who rises to become Spain's greatest matador, only to be torn between his faithful wife and a seductive aristocrat.
filmography.plot: A naive bullfighter rises to fame and fortune but falls into a destructive affair with a beautiful socialite that threatens his marriage and career.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Cinematography (Color); Nominated – Best Art Direction

filmography.title: The Black Swan
filmography.role_description: A dashing pirate who is pardoned and recruited by the new governor of Jamaica to help hunt down his former renegade allies.
filmography.plot: A reformed pirate helps the new governor of Jamaica rid the Caribbean of the notorious buccaneers who refuse to give up their trade.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Cinematography (Color); Nominated – Best Special Effects, Best Music

filmography.title: Jesse James
filmography.role_description: A Missouri farmer who turns to banditry after railroad agents kill his mother, becoming a legendary folk hero and outlaw.
filmography.plot: After railroad agents kill their mother and steal their land, brothers Frank and Jesse James turn to bank robbery to exact revenge.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Cinematography (Color); Box office hit of 1939

filmography.title: Marie Antoinette
filmography.role_description: A Swedish nobleman who becomes the devoted lover and loyal champion of the doomed French Queen Marie Antoinette.
filmography.plot: The tragic life of Austrian Princess Marie Antoinette who becomes the Queen of France and meets her fate during the French Revolution.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Actress (Norma Shearer), Best Supporting Actor (Robert Morley), Best Art Direction, Best Music

filmography.title: Captain from Castile
filmography.role_description: A Spanish nobleman fleeing the Inquisition who joins Hernán Cortés on his expedition to conquer Mexico.
filmography.plot: A young Spanish officer is forced to flee his homeland during the Inquisition and joins the expedition of Cortez to the New World.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Music (Score)

filmography.title: Prince of Foxes
filmography.role_description: A cunning courtier and assassin for Cesare Borgia who experiences a moral awakening while on a mission to conquer a city-state.
filmography.plot: A treacherous Renaissance nobleman is sent by Cesare Borgia to infiltrate a rival city but finds his conscience tested by the city's ruler.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Cinematography (B&W), Best Costume Design

filmography.title: The Long Gray Line
filmography.role_description: An Irish immigrant who spends 50 years at West Point, rising from a dishwasher to a beloved athletic trainer and NCO.
filmography.plot: The biographical story of Marty Maher, who came to West Point as a waiter and stayed for fifty years, becoming a friend and mentor to generations of cadets.
filmography.awards: None

filmography.title: In Old Chicago
filmography.role_description: A charming, ambitious gambler and saloon owner in 1870s Chicago whose rivalry with his brother plays out against the Great Fire.
filmography.plot: Two brothers, one a rogue gambler and the other a reform-minded lawyer, clash in 1871 Chicago leading up to the Great Fire.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Alice Brady), Best Assistant Director; Nominated – Best Picture

filmography.title: Alexander's Ragtime Band
filmography.role_description: A classical violinist who rebels against his family to lead a jazz band, spanning decades of American music history.
filmography.plot: A society boy scandalizes his family by pursuing a career in ragtime instead of serious music, leading a band through the decades.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Music (Scoring); Nominated – Best Picture, Best Story, Best Original Song

filmography.title: A Yank in the R.A.F.
filmography.role_description: A cocky American pilot who ferries a bomber to England for the money but ends up joining the Royal Air Force to impress an old flame.
filmography.plot: An American pilot joins the R.A.F. during the early days of WWII to be near his girlfriend, eventually participating in the Dunkirk evacuation.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Special Effects

filmography.title: The Black Rose
filmography.role_description: A Saxon nobleman who leaves Norman-ruled England to seek his fortune in the Far East, encountering Mongol warlords.
filmography.plot: A 13th-century Saxon nobleman travels to China to find his fortune and becomes involved with a Mongol warlord and a beautiful English woman.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Costume Design

filmography.title: The Sun Also Rises
filmography.role_description: An American journalist in post-WWI Paris who suffers from impotence due to a war wound, complicating his love for Lady Brett Ashley.
filmography.plot: A group of disillusioned American expatriate writers live a dissolute lifestyle in 1920s France and Spain, centered on the running of the bulls in Pamplona.
filmography.awards: None

filmography.title: The Rains Came
filmography.role_description: A high-caste Indian doctor who dedicates his life to his people but is tempted by a forbidden romance with a married Englishwoman.
filmography.plot: In India, a dedicated doctor falls for a scandalous Englishwoman, but their romance is interrupted by a devastating earthquake and flood.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Effects; Nominated – Best Cinematography, Best Art Direction, Best Sound, Best Editing

filmography.title: Brigham Young
filmography.role_description: A fictional Mormon follower who serves as a romantic lead and audience surrogate during the arduous trek to Utah.
filmography.plot: The story of Brigham Young leading the Mormons across the American West to Salt Lake City after the death of Joseph Smith.
filmography.awards: None

filmography.title: Johnny Apollo
filmography.role_description: A college student who turns to a life of crime under an alias to pay for his embezzler father's release from prison.
filmography.plot: A son turns to crime to help his father, a convicted embezzler, but finds himself getting in too deep with the mob.
filmography.awards: None

filmography.title: Son of Fury: The Story of Benjamin Blake
filmography.role_description: A wronged nobleman who flees to the South Seas to make his fortune diving for pearls and returns to England to claim his birthright.
filmography.plot: The illegitimate son of a nobleman fights for his inheritance against his scheming uncle, traveling to the South Seas to make his fortune.
filmography.awards: None

filmography.title: This Above All
filmography.role_description: A disillusioned British soldier who deserts the army after Dunkirk but finds his courage restored through the love of an aristocratic woman.
filmography.plot: During WWII, a wealthy young woman joins the WAAF and falls in love with a disillusioned deserter, urging him to return to duty.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Art Direction; Nominated – Best Cinematography, Best Sound, Best Editing

filmography.title: Rawhide
filmography.role_description: A civilized station master's assistant who is held hostage by four desperate escaped convicts at a remote stagecoach stop.
filmography.plot: An escaped convict and his gang take over a remote way station, holding a young man and a woman hostage while they wait to rob a gold shipment.
filmography.awards: None

filmography.title: Crash Dive
filmography.role_description: A PT boat commander who is transferred to a submarine and unknowingly falls for his commanding officer's fiancée.
filmography.plot: A submarine lieutenant and his commander vie for the same woman against a backdrop of commando raids on Nazi bases.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Effects

filmography.title: Abandon Ship!
filmography.role_description: An executive officer who is forced to make agonizing life-and-death decisions when he takes command of an overcrowded lifeboat.
filmography.plot: After a luxury liner sinks, the officer in charge of an overloaded lifeboat must decide who stays and who is cast adrift to ensure the survival of the rest.
filmography.awards: None

filmography.title: The Eddy Duchin Story
filmography.role_description: The famous pianist and bandleader whose professional success is contrasted with personal tragedies, including the death of his wife.
filmography.plot: A biopic of the popular 1930s pianist and bandleader Eddy Duchin, focusing on his career and his relationship with his son.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Cinematography, Best Sound, Best Music, Best Story
